item.title: Report E-2024070294
item.description:
Report E-2024070294

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-16T09:14:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: MOSINEE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately five (5) gallons of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pila due to a forklift puncture that impacted the concrete floor. Dayton Freight personnel used absorbent pads to recover the released material and containerized the cleanup debris into two (2) 5-gallon poly pails. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070276
item.description:
Report E-2024070276

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-15T18:15:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-02
  • City: TOMAH
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XTM experienced a UN1500 Sodium Nitrite, Granular Free-Flowing Food Grade release from a 50 pound paper bag. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3 pounds of product released to a 4' x 4' area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. The damaged bag, released product, and PPE were collected into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024070218
item.description:
Report E-2024070218

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-15T18:15:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-01
  • City: MENOMONEE FALLS
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A Veolia employee was offloading pallets of drums from a trailer at Veolia's 1- day intransit facility in Menomonee Falls, WI. In the process of offloading the trailer, the forks on the forklift extended past the end of the pallet due to it being a smaller size pallet. The employee was unaware of their surroundings and length of forks, allowing the forks to puncture a drum loaded in the truck behind the pallet that was being offloaded. Approximately 1/2 of a gallon of material leaked before the employee was able to secure the drum from leaking any further. The duration of the spill was approximately 30 seconds. The material was then cleaned and the employees reported the spill of material. The drum that was damaged with the forklift was overpacked for safe transportation to the disposal facility.

item.title: Report X-2024070891
item.description:
Report X-2024070891

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-15T18:15:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-27
  • City: MIDDLETON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED FROM TRAILER AND SENT TO QC AREA VIA BELT SYSTEM. DAMAGE INSPECTION: LEAKER, QC CLERK OPENED PACKAGED AND SAW INSIDE PAIL APPEARED TO BE LEAKING AND NOTIFIED A HAZ MAT RESPONDER. PACKAGE WAS THEN PLACED IN A LINED SPILL TUB. THE INNER CONTENTS IS A 5 GALLON PAIL WITH FEDEX HAZMAT SHIPPING PAPERS ON THE LID WITH A FLAMMABLE LIQUID 3 PAINT UN1263 LABEL THE SIDE OF PAIL.

item.title: Report X-2024070661
item.description:
Report X-2024070661

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-12T15:12:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-28
  • City: MILWAUKEE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 28th a package with no indication of Dg marked on the outside was emitting a paint like odor. After opening the package a 1 gallon sized can was found inside of a bag and the can was marked as a class 3 and stated Resin on it. There was some spillage of liquid inside of the bag. The package was placed into a salvage drum and is being held pending further disposition.
